titleStmt.title: A letter from the Right Honourable Ed. Lord Montagu, one of the commissioners attending His Majesty. With a perfect narration of all the passages betwixt his majesty and those forces that brought him from Holdenby, being resident now at New-market. Both read in the House of Peeres on the tenth of June. 1647. Die Jovis 10 Junii 1647. Ordered by the Lords assembled in Parliament, that this letter, with the narration be forthwith printed and published. Joh. Brown Cler. Parliamentorum.
titleStmt.author: Sandwich, Edward Montagu, Earl of, 1625-1672.

titleStmt.title: A letter from the Right Honourable Ed. Lord Montagu, one of the commissioners attending His Majesty. With a perfect narration of all the passages betwixt his majesty and those forces that brought him from Holdenby, being resident now at New-market. Both read in the House of Peeres on the tenth of June. 1647. Die Jovis 10 Junii 1647. Ordered by the Lords assembled in Parliament, that this letter, with the narration be forthwith printed and published. Joh. Brown Cler. Parliamentorum.
titleStmt.author: Sandwich, Edward Montagu, Earl of, 1625-1672.
England and Wales. Parliament. House of Lords.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for John Wright at the Kings Head in the old Bayley.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
